admreg: Europe and Central Asia,Europe and Central Asia

abstracts.cdata!:
The proposed project would consist of
            components selected from the 1985-88 investment program of
            the General Directorate of Highways (KGM).  The loan would
            provide financing for:  (a) highway civil works; (b)
            procurement of equipment for investment and maintenance
            works; and (c) consultancy services and training.  The
            project is designed to assist KGM in the following areas:
            (i) project planning, preparation and implementation; (ii)
            development of a modern and more balanced equipment fleet
            for its investment and maintenance works; (iii) pavements
            research and management; and (iv) staff training and highway
            safety.  The project would lead to savings in transport and
            highway maintenance costs and would promote highway safety.
            Savings would accrue especially on quick benefit yielding
            routes, which also generate foreign exchange earnings
            because of transit and export traffic.  There are no unusual
            technical risks.
